author: Special Correspondent
text:
Stating that there was an urgent need to initiate a set of actions to bring about a permanent solution to the problems that plague the livelihoods of thousands of Tamil Nadu fishermen, Chief Minister Jayalalithaa asked Prime Minister Narendra Modi to secure the immediate release of 27 fishermen and 71 boats, including the 12 fishermen and their two boats, apprehended on February 11.

In a letter on Friday, she said that it was unfortunate that the arrest of fishermen from Tamil Nadu by the Sri Lankan Navy continued unabated.

She said the repeated attempts by the Sri Lankan Navy to prevent the exercise of Tamil Nadu fishermen’s traditional rights should not be allowed to continue further and needs to be halted through concerted efforts by the Centre.

Ms. Jayalalithaa said she has also repeatedly pointed out that the Sri Lankan strategy of not releasing the boats and fishing gear even after releasing the fishermen has severely impaired the means of livelihood of several fishermen.

The prolonged detention, long periods of disuse and the monsoon would have severely damaged these boats, she said and requested that the boats and fishing gear are restored and refurbished by the Centre at the earliest.
title: CM seeks release of 27 TN fishermen
